<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketSendTo_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_SocketSendTo_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, const void *buffer, size_t buflen,
                           const OS_SockAddr_t *RemoteAddr)
{
    int                             os_result;
    socklen_t                       addrlen;
    const struct sockaddr *         sa;
    OS_impl_file_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_filehandle_table, *token);

    sa = (const struct sockaddr *)&RemoteAddr->AddrData;
    switch (sa->sa_family)
    {
        case AF_INET:
            addrlen = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
            break;
#ifdef OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6
        case AF_INET6:
            addrlen = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6);
            break;
#endif
        default:
            addrlen = 0;
            break;
    }

    if (addrlen != RemoteAddr->ActualLength)
    {
        return OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS;
    }

    os_result = sendto(impl->fd, buffer, buflen, MSG_DONTWAIT, sa, addrlen);
    if (os_result < 0)
    {
        OS_DEBUG("sendto: %s\n", strerror(errno));
        return OS_ERROR;
    }

    return os_result;
}
```

explanation: Most pointer uses in this function already point to const-qualified types: the function parameters are declared const where appropriate (const OS_object_token_t *token, const void *buffer, const OS_SockAddr_t *RemoteAddr), and the local sockaddr pointer is declared const (const struct sockaddr *sa) and assigned via a cast to const. The sendto call also expects const-qualified pointers and the arguments match that. The only local pointer declared without const qualification is 'impl' which is assigned from OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET and thereafter only read (its fd member is used). Therefore 'impl' (and its assignment) should be investigated to determine whether it can be declared as a pointer to const (e.g. const OS_impl_file_internal_record_t *impl) to comply with MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13. No other pointer declarations or uses in the shown code appear to require investigation under this rule.
